intro: Thymophylla neaei, commonly known as the Neaei thymophylla, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane regions with cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Thymophylla neaei is considered a species of conservation concern.
